metadata.Title: CVE-2015-20107 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Python (aka CPython) up to 3.10.8, the mailcap module does not add escape characters into commands discovered in the system mailcap file. This may allow attackers to inject shell commands into applications that call mailcap.findmatch with untrusted input (if they lack validation of user-provided filenames or arguments). The fix is also back-ported to 3.7, 3.8, 3.9

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-20107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
python2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
libpython3.10 - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
python3.10 - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
python3.10-examples - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
python3.10-full - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
python3.10-nopie - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
python3.10-venv - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> patch was proposed in cpython Lib/mailcap.py but not merged yet. it sounds a better approach was PR to fix that issue, but still not merged yet. there are plenty of discussions going on about proper ways to fix that issue, but none was accept yet that fix the issue and keep the software working properly.

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1').
python3.10 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1').
